Content: Angie paid a total of $750 for 10 tickets to a musical. The money was taken from her bank account.

During a trivia game, a player receives 2 points for each correct answer and ‚Äì1/2 point for each incorrect answer. During round 1, Annette answers 5 questions correctly and 6 questions incorrectly.
What is Annette's score at the end of round 1?
Harry raised $10 for each kilometer he walked in a walkathon. His goal was to raise at least $300 on Saturday and Sunday. Harry raised $50 on Saturday.
Which graph shows the distances, in kilometers, that Harry could have walked on Sunday to reach his goal?

Each student could enter his or her name only once. One student who entered the raffle will be selected at random.
What is the probability that the student selected will be a seventh-grade student? Use words or numbers to justify your answer.

problems/NMG7M/media/8a.jpg
Which expression represents the distance between the two points?
Penelope thinks that the probability of getting an envelope that contains $10 is more likely than not. Which statement ùóïùóòùó¶ùóß explains whether Penelope is correct?

A.Choice: No, the probability that she will get an envelope with $10 is less than 0.5.

B.Choice: Yes, the probability that she will get an envelope with $10 is less than 0.5.

C.Choice: No, the probability that she will get an envelope with $10 is greater than 0.5.

D.Choice: Yes, the probability that she will get an envelope with $10 is greater than 0.5.

Content: Penelope claims this expression represents the probability that she will get an envelope with at least $500.
Is Penelope's claim true?

B.Choice: No, she should add 1 to the numerator.

C.Choice: No, she should add 1 to the numerator and 10 to the denominator.

D.Choice: No, she should add 1 to the numerator and subtract 1 from the denominator.

Content: The motion of a snail is shown on this graph.
problems/NMG7M/media/11a.jpg
What is the speed of the snail's motion?
In 1/2 minute, Tamara's car traveled 3/4 kilometer.
What was the rate, in kilometers per minute, of Tamara's car?
Thomas runs a 12.5-kilometer road race. There is water available for the runners every 2.5 kilometers except at the start.
How many water stops are there along the race?
It costs Jan's family $87 to rent 3 bikes for 4 hours. The cost includes a $5 fee for each bike rental plus an hourly rate.
Which method can be used to check that the hourly rate is $6?

A.Choice: Multiply 6(4). Then add 5 to the product.

B.Choice: Multiply 6(4). Then add 3(5) to the product.

C.Choice: Multiply 3(6)(4). Then add 5 to the product.

D.Choice: Multiply 3(6)(4). Then add 3(5) to the product.

:ibox:‚Ä¢ Kevin ran 2 laps in 4 minutes.

‚Ä¢ Marlow ran 3 laps in 5 minutes.
Which student ran faster, in kilometers per minute?
Nadine is researching summer camps. This double box-and-whisker plot shows the distribution of positive feedback for the same activities at two different camps.
problems/NMG7M/media/17a.jpg
Based on these data alone, which camp should Nadine attend and why?

A.Choice: Camp Sunset, because the feedback for the activities is more consistent and she is more likely to have a positive experience with her activities there

B.Choice: Camp Sunset, because the feedback for the activities is less consistent, so she is more likely to have a positive experience with her activities there

C.Choice: Camp Walden, because the feedback for the activities is more consistent and she is more likely to have a positive experience with her activities there

D.Choice: Camp Walden, because the feedback for the activities is less consistent, so she is more likely to have a positive experience with her activities there

Content: The length of a rectangle is 4 units more than 3 times its width.

What is the width, w, in units, of the second rectangle? Use an equation to show your work or explain how you know.

There are 12 boys and 14 girls in Mr. Rowe's class. Each week, Mr. Rowe puts pieces of paper with each student's name in a box and randomly pulls one out. The chosen student spins the arrow on the spinner shown.
problems/NMG7M/media/19a.jpg
Which expression can be used to find the probability that this week a boy will be chosen and the arrow will land on ‚ÄúFree assignment‚Äù?
Mario has a statue that consists of 1/10 tin and 1/4 lead. The rest of the statue consists of copper.
What fraction of the statue consists of copper?
This graph shows the relationship between the time, in seconds, and the height of the bottom of an elevator, in meters, as the elevator moves upward.
problems/NMG7M/media/21a.jpg
What does the point (4, 5) on this graph represent?

A.Choice: The bottom of the elevator is at a height of 4 meters after moving upward for 5 seconds.

B.Choice: The bottom of the elevator is at a height of 5 meters after moving upward for 4 seconds.

C.Choice: The elevator is moving upward at a speed of 4 meters per second after 5 seconds.

D.Choice: The elevator is moving upward at a speed of 5 meters per second after 4 seconds.

Content: Samantha has $22 to buy one binder and some packages of paper. One binder costs $4, and packages of paper cost $3 each. Which inequality can be used to find p, the number of packages of paper Samantha can buy along with the binder?
Which sentence describes a proportional relationship between the two sets of values?

B.Choice: Victoria paid $14.40 to mail 3 packages and $21.60 to mail 5 packages.

C.Choice: Sandra downloaded 8 songs in 12 minutes and 14 songs in 22 minutes.

D.Choice: Michael read 18 pages in 9 minutes and 36 pages in 20 minutes.

Content: Tristan is going to determine the actual floor area of the storage space of the truck.
Based on the dimensions in the scale drawing, what units should he use for the floor area of the storage space?
Barney wrote this expression for the volume, in cubic feet, of the storage space.
Four students evaluated Barney's expression. Which student's statement about Barney's expression for the volume of the storage space is true?

A.Choice: Albert says the expression is correct.

B.Choice: Felicia says the expression is missing a factor of (4)(2)(1 7/8).

C.Choice: Leia says the expression is missing a factor of (2)(1 7/8).

D.Choice: Trey says the expression is missing a factor of 1 7/8.

Content: Todd wants to buy a bagel with a filling and a jam.

What is the probability that Todd will choose a bagel with cream cheese and strawberry jam?
Four students conducted a survey about sports preferences at their middle school. Each student asked participants in their survey the same questions.

:ibox:‚Ä¢ Brian surveyed all the students in school clubs.

‚Ä¢ Ellen surveyed 10 different students in all the classes that he had in the morning.

‚Ä¢ Karter surveyed all the seventh graders who were eating sandwiches in the cafeteria at lunchtime.

‚Ä¢ Olivia surveyed each fifth person from a list containing alphabetized names of the students in the school.
Which student's survey would be ùó†ùó¢ùó¶ùóß representative of sports preferences at the school?

A local bowling team participates in a two-day tournament and records the scores for each team member on both days. The scores for both days are represented in these box-and-whisker plots.
problems/NMG7M/media/30a.jpg
Based on the box-and-whisker plots, which statement is true?

A.Choice: The scores on Friday and the scores on Saturday have the same median and interquartile range.

B.Choice: The scores on Friday have a greater median and a greater interquartile range than the scores on Saturday.

C.Choice: The scores on Friday have a greater interquartile range than the scores on Saturday, but both data sets have the same median.

D.Choice: The scores on Friday have a greater median than the scores on Saturday, but both data sets have the same interquartile range.

Content: This graph shows the cost of renting a canoe.

A.Choice: It costs $5 to rent a canoe for 1 hour.

B.Choice: It costs $2 to rent a canoe for 10 hours.

C.Choice: The unit rate is 5 hours of rental per dollar.

D.Choice: The constant of proportionality for the relationship is 5.

E.Choice: The cost of the rental is proportional to the number of hours rented.
